newsitem.title: USA: MCI to acquire $680 mln preferred News Corp stock.
newsitem.headline: MCI to acquire $680 mln preferred News Corp stock.

text.p: MCI Communications Corp has agreed to acquire $680 million in preferred stock of a U.S. division of News Corp, officials with News Corp said on Monday.

At a news conference to outline News Corp's decision to acquire an equity stake in satellite television company EchoStar, News Corp officials said the MCI investment replaces an earlier commitment by the telephone provider to invest $650 million in News Corp.

MCI and News Corp announced a broad alliance in May 1995, under which MCI bought a nine percent stake in News Corp for $1.35 billion and acquired an option to increase that stake to 13.5 percent for about $650 million.
Under the new plan, MCI will acquire the preferred shares, which are redeemable in six years, rather than increase its stake in News Corp to 13.5 percent.

Separately, chairman Rupert Murdoch confirmed that News Corp has held friendly talks with Sony Corp about Sony acquiring a stake in Japanese satellite venture JSkyB. But he did not say how far the talks had progressed.
He also said News Corp would not seek any additional equity partners for ASkyB now it had completed the deal with EchoStar.
